analysis.heading: Allowable setback encroachments summary
analysis.content: A portion of the main dwelling (no wider than half the max width of the dwelling), may encroach into the rear setback, at the ground floor only, as follows: For all lots except back-to-back corner lots, up to 5', providing a minimum setback of 14' is maintained. For back-to-back corner lots, up to 10', providing a minimum setback of 15' is maintained. Notes: Multiple protrusions are not permitted; addition must be contiguous with existing protrusion. Only for legally constructed structures (no variance or an home-improvement exception [HIE]). Only once in the life of the structure.
tables: Feature table containing allowable encroachments for: Main dwelling, Detached accessory structures, Porches and entry features, Other features, and Excavated features
